Your hair needs the same well-rounded diet that provides all the recommended vitamins, minerals, and other nutrients needed for good health in the rest of your body. Take protein, for example. B-Vitamins deficiencies and hair loss. Lack of B vitamins (such as B1 and B2) can lead to undernourishment of cells of hair follicles. Protein deficiency. As hair is made mostly of protein, eating a diet that contains sufficient levels of protein is considered essential for keeping hair healthy, strong and growing naturally. A deficiency can lead to thin, brittle hair or hair loss.
